results.title: Evolution
results.brief_description: An animated film telling the story of how life came into being on this planet. The animator, Michael Mills, describes the process in this film - from the time when a single-celled amoebae romped about the ocean depths until the first amphibious creatures crawled onto land, eventually to become the progenitor of homo sapiens himself. (Winner of eleven awards.)

results.title: Evidence for the Ice Age
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance, Stanley Croner and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Explains how anomalous geological formations such as moraines and erratics, polished and straited rocks, resulting from glacial action, show that much of the temperate area has been under ice sheets. For schools.

results.title: Evidence
results.creator_credit: Claire Pentecost, Critical Art Ensemble, Igor Vamos and Steve Kurtz
results.brief_description: Video evidence of the FBI raid of Professor Steve Kurtz’s home which led to his being charged with bio terrorism. The video has a voice over relating the history of events, and shows the aftermath of the FBI raids. This video was created specifically for the exhibition PROOF held in the ACMI screen gallery December 2004.

results.title: Everything under the sun [Turkish version]
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Who are the Australians? The film shows them at work, at home and at play. It depicts the sophistication of the cities and the sparseness of the outback. It reveals that already there are traditions and national pride. A study of Australia and Australians with all the variety and colour of the modern Australian scene. Note: A short version, intended mainly for overseas viewers, of “After Cook”. In English and Turkish.

results.title: Everything and nothing
results.brief_description: A thought-provoking documentary based on a one-to-one intimate discussion with the director Jayce Salloum (This is not Beirut, Introduction to the end of an argument) and Soha Bechara, a Lebanese National Resistance fighter. Born in Beirut in 1967, Soha speaks candidly and openly about her life and experiences living and growing up under Israeli occupation, of joining the Lebanese National Resistance Movement (Jabhat al Muquawama al Watanieh Lubnaniya) in 1986, of her capture by the Israelis in 1988 and her forced detention for the next ten years in the Khiam detention centre in South Lebanon until her eventual release on September 3, 1998. Reflective about the past, Soha’s thoughts however are with the future and maintaining a strong commitment to carrying on the “political, economical, social and cultural struggle” for the ones who still remain in the detention centre and for the liberation of Lebanon from Israeli occupation. The interview solely takes place in Soha’s Paris room one year after her release. A poignant and sensitive film enhanced by the intimacy and interaction between filmmaker and subject. Note: No title or credits appear in the film.

results.title: Everything about bicycles
results.brief_description: By following the ups and downs of an animated ‘everyman’ we see the bicycle’s history and evolution, its maintenance and riding in a great variety of situations.
